trial_identification.studytitle: Ultrasound guided corticosteroid injection for plantar fasciitis: a randomised controlled trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Ultrasound guided corticosteroid injection for treatment of pain associated with plantar fasciitis: a randomised controlled trial

interventions.interventions: Ultrasound guided injection of the plantar fascia with 1mL of 4mg/mL dexamethasone sodium phosphate
interventions.comparator: Ultrasound guided injection of the plantar fascia with 1mL normal (isotonic) saline

primaryOutcome.outcome: Pain measured on a visual analogue scale
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, then 1, 2 and 3 months post randomisation

primaryOutcome.outcome: Plantar fascia thickness measured by diagnostic ultrasound
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, then 1, 2 and 3 months post randomisation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Function measured by the Foot Health Status Questionnaire
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, then 1, 2 and 3 months post randomisation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Daily use of oral analgesic medication, self-reported in a diary
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, then 1, 2 and 3 months post randomisation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: First step pain measured on a visual analogue scale
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, then 1, 2 and 3 months post randomisation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
History of pain beneath the heel for minimum 8 weeks
Minimum heel pain magnitude of 20mm on visual analogue scale
Sensitivity to palpation of medial calcaneal tubercle and/or the proximal plantar fascia
Minimum plantar fascia thickness value of 4.0mm as measured by ultrasound
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Corticosteroid injection for plantar fasciitis within previous 6 months. Known hypersensitivity to lignocaine or dexamethasone. Current skin or soft tissue infection near injection site. Current pregnancy. Systemic inflammatory disease. Diabetes Mellitus. Previous local surgery or trauma. Commencement of any treatment for plantar fasciitis within four weeks prior to enrolment

trial_design.concealment: Allocation will be concealed in a password-protected computer file.
trial_design.sequence: Treatment allocation will be performed according to a computer-generated random allocation sequence.

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Musculoskeletal Research Centre, La Trobe University

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this project is to evaluate the effectiveness of corticosteroid injection versus normal saline (placebo) for treatment of chronic pain beneath the heel (plantar fasciitis).
